intro: Urceola huaitingii, commonly known as the Huaitingii Urceola, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence, while its flowers are predominantly blue or purple. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
